com.coreconsulting.res.openehr.tdd2rm

Class TDD

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.coreconsulting.res.openehr.tdd2rm.util.XML
      • com.coreconsulting.res.openehr.tdd2rm.TDD

  • public class TDD
extends XML
    This class implements functionality related to TDD handling, such as deserializing it from a XML instance, resolving the openEHR namespace prefix, @template_id and associated TDS, generic node manipulation and transformation to an openEHR Reference Model composition. The TDD is expected to match a TDS represented by a XML Schema exported from Ocean's Template Designer.
    Author:
    Ricardo Gon√ßalves <ricardo.goncalves@coreconsulting.com.br>

    • Method Detail

      • getNamespacePrefix

        public java.lang.String getNamespacePrefix()
        Parses the openEHR namespace prefix used used in the TDD by matching the namespace declaration of { OPENEHR_NS}. Once parsed, it is stored as a field for future use. If OPENEHR_NS is the default namespace, it is reassigned to the prefix "oe:" to prevent XSI issues with abstract types (@xsi:type).
        Returns:
        openEHR namespace prefix.

      • getRMVersion

        public java.lang.String getRMVersion()
        Returns the openEHR Reference Model release version.
        Returns:
        openEHR Reference Model release version

      • getTDSLocation

        public java.lang.String getTDSLocation()
        Parses the TDS schema location (@xsi:schemaLocation) from the TDD by matching the xsi:schemaLocation entry that matches Ocean's Template Designer default namespace (http://schemas.oceanehr.com/templates).
        Returns:
        TDS schema location

      • getTemplateId

        public java.lang.String getTemplateId()
        Parses the @template_id from the TDD root element. Once parsed, it is stored as a field for future use.
        Returns:
        @template_id from the TDD root element

      • getTDS

        public TDS getTDS()
        Parses the TDS which this TDD complies to. First it attempts to look it up from a local cache using the @template_id as a key, then, if unavailable, it grabs it from @xsi:schemaLocation. Once parsed, it is stored as a field for future use.
        Returns:
        TDS which this TDD complies to

      • insertNameAsFirstChild

        public void insertNameAsFirstChild(org.w3c.dom.Element parent,
                                   java.lang.String text)
        Generic node transformation method that inserts a name as the first child of a specific element. Used for cases in which the TDD and TDS don't specify a name but the openEHR Reference Model requires one.
        Parameters:
        parent - parent element to insert the name into
        text - value of the name child

      • insertNameBeforeElement

        public void insertNameBeforeElement(org.w3c.dom.Element parent,
                                    org.w3c.dom.Element sibling,
                                    java.lang.String text)
        Generic node transformation method that inserts a name as a child before a specific sibling within a parent element. Used for classes in which the TDD and TDS don't specify a name but the openEHR Reference Model requires one.
        Parameters:
        parent - parent element to insert the name into
        sibling - sibling element which the name child is to be inserted before
        text - value of the name child

      • toRM

        public org.w3c.dom.Document toRM()
                          throws UnsupportedTypeException
        Generates a clone of the TDD document and transforms it into a openEHR Reference Model composition, parsing the document from the root element.
        Returns:
        openEHR Reference Model composition generated from the TDD
        Throws:
        UnsupportedTypeException - when transforming a TDD with a type that isn't supported

      • transformNode

        protected void transformNode(org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                             java.lang.StringBuilder xsdXPath)
                      throws UnsupportedTypeException
        Transforms a node from the TDD into the standardized representation from the openEHR Reference Model. The algorithm is a postorder tree traversal, so it recursively traverses all descendants and then applies any transformations. The XPath expression to look up the definition of the TDD element in the related TDS is also built recursively through node introspection.
        Parameters:
        node - current node being traversed
        xsdXPath - XPath expression that matches the current node in the associated TDS
        Throws:
        UnsupportedTypeException - when trying to transform a node of a type with no transformation available (see TransformerFactory)
